result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for DE to be excused from testing from 10/09/22 to 10/13/22. Filed by Atty Anderson. arc      Per RMW on 10-6-2022: The def. is excused from testing between 10/9 and 10/13. JA will let Attys and JSC know. RJG   10/13  Per RMW: Testing is just suspended for now. He can consider the request to end testing at the next court date. JSS advised and atty Anderson.tfy

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Westfields Hospital or New Richmond Police Department, unless in their official capacity.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:30 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Fox, Defendant Zachariah NMI Albert in court. Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson appeared by video/zoom for Zachariah NMI Albert.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status check for attorney. Court notes Atty Anderson is representing def. ADA Becker requests a new bond and another INIT.  Court proceeds to a REPEATED INIT: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.

2:38 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. ADA: Michael Becker  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah Harrelson for today Defendant Zachariah NMI Albert in court. ADA Becker believes DE is intoxicated and requests DE be given PBT. ADA Becker makes record of remark made by DE in hallway. DE responds. Court orders DE to submit to PBT. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court enters NG plea and sets STC. Court services deputy to escort Defendant to JSC for PBT test. Court states DE will not be held if there is a positive test. Adjourned at 2:45 PM.  gll
